name: La vie d'Arcade - Anglophone adaptation
description:
Controls: Left click, space bar or enter

Duration: 5-10 minutes

La vie d'Arcade, released in 2014, was the first digital game about Acadian culture. This version, an adaptation of the original bilingual game, was built to share several scenes with the English-speaking world.

These scenes highlight realities of the Acadian community that our Anglophone neighbours might not have considered before.

Click here for the full version of the game.

This project, created by Chad Comeau and commissioned by the FRAP, was exhibited at the Nocturne Art at Night 2016 festival in Halifax, Nova-Scotia
